metadata.title: Introduction to MultipeerConnectivity
metadata.category: Building a Nearby File Sharing App with MultipeerConnectivity

inlineContent.text: Learn the core concepts of the MultipeerConnectivity framework and
basic setup for nearby communication.
Let’s look at the main classes in MultipeerConnectivity.
Import MultipeerConnectivity into your project.
MultipeerConnectivity is a framework that enables direct
communication with nearby devices via Wi-Fi, P2P Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth.
You can exchange data, streams, and files
without an internet connection.
Use the
key.
Add local network access permission.
Register the Bonjour service type.
Add the service type to the
array.
Add permission for Bluetooth usage as well.
To use MultipeerConnectivity,
you need to configure required permissions in Info.plist.
Local network access and Bonjour service setup are required.
Define the service type constant.
The same service type must be used throughout the app.
Write the basic structure of the MultipeerManager class.
Make it an ObservableObject to integrate with SwiftUI.
In MultipeerConnectivity, service types identify
devices running the same app.
Service types consist of 1-15 lowercase letters and numbers.
Wi-Fi
Wi-Fi is a communication method supported by MultipeerConnectivity.
Bluetooth
Bluetooth is a communication method supported by MultipeerConnectivity.
Cellular Network
MultipeerConnectivity only supports Wi-Fi, P2P Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth.
It does not support cellular networks.
Which is NOT a communication method supported by MultipeerConnectivity?
Service types consist of 1-15 lowercase letters and numbers,
and may include hyphens (-).
1-15 lowercase letters and numbers
Uppercase letters cannot be used in service types.
A word starting with uppercase
UUID format
A short string is used, not UUID format.
What is the correct format for a service type?

set a unique ID that distinguishes you from other peers.
